definition: to apologize for an offense/to offer one's apology for a fault
to thank/to apologize/to wither (of flowers, leaves etc)/to decline

sentences.english: Jiangchuan for the failure of shame, she is going to cut abdomen to the emperor to malaysians.
sentences.chinese: 江川爲這次的失敗羞愧難當，她準備切腹向天皇謝罪。

sentences.english: Both to the people and sent into the oracle to address, male aggregates worship table malaysians.
sentences.chinese: 既至，遣人入交址諭以利害，公蘊拜表謝罪。

sentences.english: With so long a time in between, it is too late even to apologize.
sentences.chinese: 隔了這麼久，恐怕連謝罪自譴的有效期也早過了吧？

sentences.english: Chinese fir without complaint, to die to malaysians to caesarean section.
sentences.chinese: 杉木毫無怨言，欲剖腹以死謝罪。

sentences.english: The reply has been delayed for so long that I’m afraid even a heartfelt apology has already lost its power.
sentences.chinese: 隔了這麼久，恐怕連謝罪自譴的有效期也早過了吧。

definition: relatives/members of the same family, clan, tribe etc
to communicate by means of written notes (instead of speaking)/to publish one's opinion (e.g. as part of a scholarly dialogue)/(in book titles) essays/sketches
cap badge (official sign of rank in Qing dynasty)
Takeshima (Korean Dokdo 獨島|独岛[Du2 dao3]), disputed islands in Sea of Japan
to thank sb for favor (esp. emperor or superior official)
to regulate/rules and regulations/regulatory/style and structure (esp. of building)
the original name of 孫中山|孙中山[Sun1 Zhong1 shan1], Dr Sun Yat-sen (1866-1925), first president of the Republic of China and co-founder of the Guomintang 國民黨|国民党[Guo2 min2 dang3]
